question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find the vector $\mathbf{v}$ such that
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}} \mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{38}{5} \\ \frac{19}{5} \end{pmatrix}\]and
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}} \mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{58}{13} \\ \frac{87}{13} \end{pmatrix}.\]
inference:
Let $\mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix}$.  Then
\begin{align*} \operatorname{proj}_{\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}} \mathbf{v} &= \frac{\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix}}{\left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2} \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} = \frac{2x + y}{5} \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{4x + 2y}{5} \\ \frac{2x + y}{5} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{38}{5} \\ \frac{19}{5} \end{pmatrix}. \end{align*}This gives us the equations
\begin{align*} \frac{4x + 2y}{5} &= \frac{38}{5}, \\ \frac{2x + y}{5} &= \frac{19}{5}. \end{align*}These equations reduce to
\begin{align*} 4x + 2y &= 38, \\ 2x + y &= 19. \end{align*}Similarly,
\begin{align*} \operatorname{proj}_{\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}} \mathbf{v} &= \frac{\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix}}{\left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \right\|^2} \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} = \frac{2x + 3y}{13} \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{4x + 6y}{13} \\ \frac{6x + 9y}{13} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{58}{13} \\ \frac{87}{13} \end{pmatrix}. \end{align*}This gives us the equations
\begin{align*} \frac{4x + 6y}{13} &= \frac{58}{13}, \\ \frac{6x + 9y}{13} &= \frac{87}{13}. \end{align*}These equations reduce to
\begin{align*} 4x + 6y &= 58, \\ 6x + 9y &= 87. \end{align*}From the first set of equations, $2x + y = 19$.  From the second set of equations, $2x + 3y = 29$.  Subtracting $2x + y = 19$ from $2x + 3y = 29$, we get $2y = 10$, so $y = 5$. Then $2x + 5 = 19$, so $2x = 14$ and $x = 7$.  Thus, $\mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ 5 \end{pmatrix}$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ 5 \end{pmatrix}}$ I hope it is correct.

Subtracting $2x + y = 19$ from $2x + 3y = 29$, we get $2y = 10$, so $y = 5$. Then $2x + 5 = 19$, so $2x = 14$ and $x = 7$.  Thus, $\mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ 5 \end{pmatrix}$.
